column4: motunes: Also, let me know if i have to extract the contents of the iso and place inside a folder
Please keep in mind that UNIX is case-sensetive
i typed this "gksu `/Desktop/ubuntu-10.04-desktop-amd64.iso" and i am taken to '>' prompt
Besides, it's a desktop image, why would you want to mount it?
so, i need to extract it to a folder and then try to the command
No, you need to mount it
i didnt get the upgrade dialogue after mounting
I told ya, it's a DESKTOP image, you need an ALTERNATE one to upgrade
No such thing as "super user" or "root" password
I am trying to run synaptic package manager from limited privileges user profile and synaptic is not launching
I entered the root password when prompted for
There is no root password, really...
It asks for YOUR password (your account has to be in "admin" group for it to work)
If my account is not in admin group, am i supposed to receive error or is it that the application doesn't launch at all (like in my case, synaptic is not launching)
It should give "you are not authorized to run the basic authenication mechanism (sudo)", however that warning dissapeared somewhere in Lucid
